com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api

Class WowzaGoCoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.WowzaGoCoder

  • public final class WowzaGoCoder
extends java.lang.Object
    Use this class to initialize the GoCoder SDK and to get access to device and platform information.

    Note: Many methods in this class are deprecated. Use the recommended alternatives instead.

    To build apps with the GoCoder SDK for Android, follow this basic workflow.

    1. Initialize the SDK using init(Context, String).

      2. Note: You must call init(Context, String) to validate the GoCoder SDK license key before making any other calls with the SDK.

    2. Configure the broadcast stream by creating an instance of WOWZBroadcastConfig.
    3. Capture and stream from the active device camera by creating an instance of WOWZCameraView in your application's layout resources, or create one dynamically and configure the broadcast to use it with WOWZBroadcastConfig.setVideoBroadcaster(WOWZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster).
    4. Capture and stream audio from the standard audio input device by creating an instance of WOWZAudioDevice and configuring the broadcast to use it via WOWZBroadcastConfig.setAudioBroadcaster(WOWZBroadcastAPI.AudioBroadcaster).
    5. Create and control the broadcast stream by creating an instance of WOWZBroadcast.

    Visit GoCoder SDK for Android samples on GitHub to download the latest sample app code.

      • init

        public static WowzaGoCoder init(android.content.Context context,
                                java.lang.String apiLicenseKey)
        Initializes the GoCoder SDK. If initialization fails, returns null and you can call getLastError() to retrieve error information.
        Parameters:
        context - The current app.
        apiLicenseKey - The GoCoder SDK license key.
        Returns:
        The static GoCoder SDK initializer that you can use to retrieve platform information.
